_1: project_title: User-visible title of the project.
_2: repo_name: Preferably lowercase codename, used for the directory structure and Python modules.
_4: include_celery: Include Celery with Redis as the broker.  [yes/no]
_5: include_docs: Include docs generated by Sphinx.  [yes/no]
_6: live_hostname: Production hostname of the site (e.g. example.com).
_7: test_host: Hostname of your test server.
_8: live_host: Hostname of your live server.
_9: admin_email: Administrative email (for Django, Letâ€™s Encrypt, etc).
_10: vcs: Which VCS will the generated project be using?  [git/hg/none]
_11: python_version: Which python version will the generated project be using?  [3.4/3.5/3.6]
_12: node_version: Which Node.js version will the generated project be using?  [10 >=]
_13: postgres_version: Which version Postgres container will the project be using in the server?  [9.5+]",
_14: django_admin_path: URL path for Django Admin.
_15: django_host_prefix: Host name prefix for Django app.
_16: django_media_engine: Which CDN to use for media files [S3/GCS].
_17: gitlab_repo_url: Optional Gitlab repo url (https://gitlab.com/org/repo, used for CI badges).
